mod.chiselsandbits.help.magnifying_glass: Hover over block to check if compatible.
mod.chiselsandbits.help.chiseled_block.l: Left-click to place the block. Sneak while placing to ignore block grid. Shift + Mouse Wheel to cycle placement rotation.
mod.chiselsandbits.help.bit_bag.long: Automatically re-stocks, and store bits when you exceed or go under a stack in your inventory.\n\nCraft with any dye to color.
mod.chiselsandbits.help.wrench.long: Right-click blocks to rotate them around the axis of the face you click.
mod.chiselsandbits.help.tape_measure.lon: Left-click to and drag to measure spaces. Sneak Use to remove previously created measurements. Use the menu to switch between measurement modes.
mod.chiselsandbits.help.magnifying_glass: This item allows for the analysis of blocks in the world. It allows you by hovering over a block to see, why a block is supported by Chisels and Bits or why not.
mod.chiselsandbits.help.bit.long: Left-click to chisel the highlighted area. Right-click to place at the designated area.
mod.chiselsandbits.help.positiveprint.lo: Right-click on a chiseled block to write the design. Right-click on a block to chisel it adding and removing any bits that do not match the design. You can also place the design in a crafting table and Craft with bits/bags. Shift + Mouse Wheel can be used to cycle rotations without moving.
mod.chiselsandbits.help.negativeprint.lo: Right-click on a chiseled block to write the design. Right-click on a block to chisel it removing any bits that are not in the negative design. Shift + Mouse Wheel can be used to cycle rotations without moving.
mod.chiselsandbits.help.mirrorprint.long: Right-click on a chiseled block face on wish to mirror from, clicking an east facing face will mirror it along the east->west axis. Craft written design with a positive or negative design to transfer the mirror image to the type of design you want.
mod.chiselsandbits.help.chisel.long: Left-click any compatible block to chisel. Right-click to cycle through chisel modes, you can also use Shift + Mouse Wheel to cycle modes.
mod.chiselsandbits.help.bitsaw.long: Craft this saw with supported blocks, or symmetrical chiseled blocks to cut them in half. The axis of cutting is determined by the position of the saw related the block, cut along the X axis with the saw to the side, along the Y axis if the saw is above or below, and Z is if the saw is diagonal.
mod.chiselsandbits.help.bittank.long: Right-click with a bucket to insert/remove fluid. Right-click without a bucket to extract bits from a filled tank, shift+right click inserts bits in your hand, inserting with an empty hand will attempt to insert as many bits as possible. You can use automation such as hoppers to extract bits from a tank with fluid in it.
mod.chiselsandbits.help.trash: Delete Bag Contents, Hold Item to filter.
mod.chiselsandbits.help.reallytrash: Click again to confirm deletion of all
mod.chiselsandbits.help.reallytrash_blan: Click again to confirm deletion of %s
mod.chiselsandbits.help.pattern.sealed:
A sealed pattern. Created by applying a sealant on a simple pattern.
Can be used multiple times
mod.chiselsandbits.help.pattern.simple:
A simple chiseled block pattern.
Can only be used once, but is modifiable.
Created by writing down the pattern with a quill while looking at a chiseled block.
mod.chiselsandbits.help.quill:
The quill can be used to write down patterns.
Hold down right click while holding a piece of paper in your other hand when looking at a chiseled block.
mod.chiselsandbits.help.sealant:
The sealant can be used to make simple patterns last.
Protecting the information written on them.
Hold right click while holding a simple pattern in your other hand to apply the seal.
mod.chiselsandbits.help.unseal:
The sealant remover can be used to remove the seal from a sealed pattern.
This removes the protection from the pattern and will allow you to modify a pattern again.
The downside of this procedure is that the pattern becomes fragile and can then again only be used once.
Hold right click while holding a sealed pattern in your other hand to remove the seal.
commands.setbit.outOfWorld: Cannot place block outside of the world
commands.setbit.spaceOccupied: Bit cannot be placed space is occupied
mod.chiselsandbits.chisel.station.name: Chisel Station
mod.chiselsandbits.chisel.station.help: Allows mass production of a single material chiseled pattern.
mod.chiselsandbits.chisel.station.help.l: Allows you to mass produce a single pattern multiple times. However only allows a single material to be used, replacing any exiting material in the pattern.
mod.chiselsandbits.modification.table.he: Allows for modification of unsealed patterns.
Several different operations can be applied to an unsealed pattern. Additionally you can see a pattern modification before applying it.
mod.chiselsandbits.advancements.root.des: Get yourself a chisel and start diving into the world of bits.
mod.chiselsandbits.advancements.find-chi: A magnifying glass helps while discovering the world.
mod.chiselsandbits.advancements.collect-: All these little things have to go somewhere. These bags are useful!
mod.chiselsandbits.advancements.make-tan: Get fluid bits by using a bit tank.
mod.chiselsandbits.pattern.placement.fai: Can not place pattern: It will collide with existing material!
Can not place pattern: No space for bits in your inventory or bags!
Can not place pattern: Not all bits are in your inventory or bags!
Can not place pattern: The targeted block is not solid!
Can not place pattern: The targeted block is not chiseled!
Can not place pattern: The targeted block is not empty!
Can not place pattern: The targeted block can not be chiseled!
You can not redo your last undo!
Cycle Tool mode to the left
Cycle Tool mode to the right
mod.chiselsandbits.config.balancing.comm: Config options related to balancing the mod.
mod.chiselsandbits.config.balancing.bit-: The max size of the stacks of bits in the bit bag.
mod.chiselsandbits.config.balancing.blac: Disallow blocks which tick randomly from being chiseled.
mod.chiselsandbits.config.balancing.chan: The amount of changes that are being held in the change track.
mod.chiselsandbits.config.balancing.enab: Enables the compatibility mode of the chiselability checked.
mod.chiselsandbits.config.compat.comment: Configures options related to different compatibility modules.
mod.chiselsandbits.config.compat.jei.inj: Should C&B inject its bits into JEI?
mod.chiselsandbits.config.gui.radial-men: Should the mouse indicator be rendered?
mod.chiselsandbits.config.help.comment: Options for getting help in game.
mod.chiselsandbits.config.help.enabled-i: Should the help information be visible in tooltips?
mod.chiselsandbits.config.performance.ca: Size of the bit storage inner models cache.
Size of the model face cache.
Size of the block model cache.
Size of the collision box cache.
mod.chiselsandbits.config.performance.li: Should C&B pull lighting values from blockstates.
Should C&B pull lighting values from model faces.
mod.chiselsandbits.config.performance.mo: Options related to the building of the chiseled block models.
How many CPU threads should be used to build models?
mod.chiselsandbits.config.settings.bit-b: Should the durability bar display the emptiness of the bag instead of the fullness?
mod.chiselsandbits.config.settings.chise: Configures the chiseling and placement previews.
Configures the default chiseling and placement preview.
Configures the colors of the outlines that the chiseling and placement preview have.
The color for the chiseling preview outline.
The color for the placement preview outline.
Sets which preview renderer is in use. Currently C&B provides: `chiselsandbits:default` (Simple outline rendering) and `chiselsandbits:noop` (No preview) as options.
mod.chiselsandbits.config.settings.selec: Configures the tool mode icons used to render the selected tool modes of tools in the hot bar.
Sets which tool mode icon renderer is in use. Currently C&B provides: `chiselsandbits:group` (Render the group icon in the top right corner) and `chiselsandbits:noop` (No icon) as options.
mod.chiselsandbits.config.style.comment: Configures the different gameplay style options.
mod.chiselsandbits.config.style.bit-size: Configures the size of a single bit, relative to one block.
